name: 林彥良
objective: This course is expected to expand students' writing capacity and experience by helping them to formulate, organize, and present ideas clearly in well-formed paragraphs and compositions. Students will learn about rewriting, outlining, paraphrasing, synthesizing, documenting, note-taking, writing the draft and editing their own work.
schedule: A detailed syllabus will be distributed on the first day of class.
scorePolicy:
Class Attendance & Participation: 20%
Midterm & Final Essays: 40%
Quizzes & Assignments: 40%
materials: Smalley, R. L., Ruetten, M. K. & Kozyrev, J. R. (2012) Refining Composition Skills. Boston: National Geographic Learning.
